The authoritative version of this document remains the original Portuguese transcription.
translation:
I received your letter through Captain Manuel Antunes, which I greatly appreciated for your health; as I have a messenger to send to you, I write this to take advantage of the opportunity to inform you that everyone is in perfect health, but missing you in your absence, and I even more so, for you well know the esteem I have for your amiable company. Therefore, I earnestly ask you to take care of a life that is, for me, the most important thing in this world; and besides this, keep in your thoughts that we have children and that your absence would be of great harm to them, so caution and more caution; and I remain calm in the persuasion that my pleas will be attended to.

I have greatly missed your news, and I do not know where this is coming from, but it is not . Accept many regards from our compadre José Félix, as well as from my parents, and compadre Rolino, and our children.

Captain Manuel Antunes has been urging the President to take possession; it has not been possible to convince him for now because of Ribas and others as far as I follow. Today, the people from the coast are gathering to be ready until further notice from the said Lord.
